RAMYEON

Korean ramyeon is a type of instant noodle that is popular in South Korea. It is typically made from wheat flour, vegetable oil, and salt, and is often flavored with beef, chicken, or shrimp.

4 servings 3 minutes
THIS IS AN ADVERT

Equipment

  • Large bowl
  • Measuring cups and spoons
  • Knife
  • Cutting board
  • Pot
  • Colander

Ingredients

  • Wheat flour
  • Vegetable oil
  • Salt
  • Beef
  • Chicken
  • Shrimp

Directions

  1. In a large bowl, combine the wheat flour, vegetable oil, and salt.
  2. Mix in the beef, chicken, or shrimp.
  3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
  4. Cook the noodles in boiling water for 3 minutes.
  5. Drain the noodles and serve with your favorite sauce.
